info.title: Azure Quota Extension API
info.description: Microsoft Azure Quota Resource Provider. This Swagger is for Azure Group Quota using GroupQuota Entity.

put.summary: Creates a new GroupQuota for the name passed.
put.description: Creates a new GroupQuota for the name passed. A RequestId will be returned by the Service. The status can be polled periodically. The status Async polling is using standards defined at - https://github.com/Azure/azure-resource-manager-rpc/blob/master/v1.0/async-api-reference.md#asynchronous-operations. Use the OperationsStatus URI provided in Azure-AsyncOperation header, the duration will be specified in retry-after header. Once the operation gets to terminal state - Succeeded | Failed, then the URI will change to Get URI and full details can be checked.

parameters.name: GroupQuotaPutRequestBody
parameters.description: The GroupQuota body details for creation or update of a GroupQuota entity.

Retry-After.description: The recommended number of seconds to wait before calling the URI specified in Azure-AsyncOperation.

Location.description:
URL for determining when an operation has completed. Send a GET request to the URL in Location header.
The URI should return a 202 until the operation reaches a terminal state and 200 once it reaches a terminal state.

For more info: https://github.com/Azure/azure-resource-manager-rpc/blob/master/v1.0/Addendum.md#202-accepted-and-location-headers.  New guidelines - https://github.com/microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#131-resource-based-long-running-operations-relo

Azure-AsyncOperation.description:
URL for checking the ongoing status of the operation.
To get the status of the asynchronous operation, send a GET request to the URL in Azure-AsyncOperation header value.

For more info: https://github.com/Azure/azure-resource-manager-rpc/blob/master/v1.0/Addendum.md#asynchronous-operations

patch.summary: Updates a new GroupQuotas for the name passed.
patch.description:
Updates the GroupQuotas for the name passed. A GroupQuotas RequestId will be returned by the Service. The status can be polled periodically. The status Async polling is using standards defined at - https://github.com/Azure/azure-resource-manager-rpc/blob/master/v1.0/async-api-reference.md#asynchronous-operations. Use the OperationsStatus URI provided in Azure-AsyncOperation header, the duration will be specified in retry-after header. Once the operation gets to terminal state - Succeeded | Failed, then the URI will change to Get URI and full details can be checked. 
 Any change in the filters will be applicable to the future quota assignments, existing quota allocated to subscriptions from the GroupQuotas remains unchanged.

Retry-After.description: The recommended number of seconds to wait before calling the URI specified in Azure-AsyncOperation.

Location.description:
URL for determining when an operation has completed. Send a GET request to the URL in Location header.
The URI should return a 202 until the operation reaches a terminal state and 200 once it reaches a terminal state.

For more info: https://github.com/Azure/azure-resource-manager-rpc/blob/master/v1.0/Addendum.md#202-accepted-and-location-headers

Azure-AsyncOperation.description:
URL for checking the ongoing status of the operation.
To get the status of the asynchronous operation, send a GET request to the URL in Azure-AsyncOperation header value.

For more info: https://github.com/Azure/azure-resource-manager-rpc/blob/master/v1.0/Addendum.md#asynchronous-operations

get.summary: Gets GroupQuotas for the name passed.
get.description: Gets the GroupQuotas for the name passed. It will return the GroupQuotas properties only. The details on group quota can be access from the group quota APIs.

delete.summary: Deletes GroupQuotas for the name passed.
delete.description: Deletes the GroupQuotas for the name passed. All the remaining shareQuota in the GroupQuotas will be lost.

Retry-After.description: The recommended number of seconds to wait before calling the URI specified in Azure-AsyncOperation.

Location.description:
URL for determining when an operation has completed. Send a GET request to the URL in Location header.
The URI should return a 202 until the operation reaches a terminal state and 200 once it reaches a terminal state.

For more info: https://github.com/Azure/azure-resource-manager-rpc/blob/master/v1.0/Addendum.md#202-accepted-and-location-headers

get.summary: Lists GroupQuotas for the scope passed.
get.description: Lists GroupQuotas for the scope passed. It will return the GroupQuotas QuotaEntity properties only.The details on group quota can be access from the group quota APIs.

put.description: Adds a subscription to GroupQuotas. The subscriptions will be validated based on the additionalAttributes defined in the GroupQuota. The additionalAttributes works as filter for the subscriptions, which can be included in the GroupQuotas. The request's TenantId is validated against the subscription's TenantId.

Retry-After.description: The recommended number of seconds to wait before calling the URI specified in Azure-AsyncOperation.

Location.description:
URL for determining when an operation has completed. Send a GET request to the URL in Location header.
The URI should return a 202 until the operation reaches a terminal state and 200 once it reaches a terminal state.

get.summary: Returns the subscriptionId along with its provisioning state for being associated with the GroupQuotas.
get.description: Returns the subscriptionIds along with its provisioning state for being associated with the GroupQuota. If the subscription is not a member of GroupQuota, it will return 404, else 200.

get.summary: Returns a list of the subscriptionIds for the GroupQuotas.
get.description: Returns a list of the subscriptionIds associated with the GroupQuotas.

get.summary: List the status of all requests to add subscriptionIds to the GroupQuotasEntity.
get.description: List API to check the status of a subscriptionId requests by requestId. Request history is maintained for 1 year.

200.description: Success, with the details of the subscriptionId request.

get.summary: Get the status of a single subscriptionId request by requestId. The Async pattern will be used, if we determine the request is taking longer, else it can return 200 response as response to the subscription add API call.
get.description: Get API to check the status of a subscriptionIds request by requestId.  Use the polling API - OperationsStatus URI specified in Azure-AsyncOperation header field, with retry-after duration in seconds to check the intermediate status. This API provides the finals status with the request details and status.

200.description: Success, with the details of the subscriptionId request.

patch.summary: Create the GroupQuota requests for a specific ResourceProvider/Location/Resource.
patch.description:
Create the GroupQuota requests for a specific ResourceProvider/Location/Resource. The resourceName properties are specified in the request body. Only 1 resource quota can be requested. Please note that patch request creates a new groupQuota request.
Use the polling API - OperationsStatus URI specified in Azure-AsyncOperation header field, with retry-after duration in seconds to check the intermediate status. This API provides the finals status with the request details and status.

parameters.name: groupQuotaRequest
parameters.description: The GroupQuotaRequest body details for specific resourceProvider/location/resources.

200.description: Success, with the details of the group quota request.

Retry-After.description: The recommended number of seconds to wait before calling the URI specified in Azure-AsyncOperation.

URL for determining when an operation has completed. Send a GET request to the URL in Location header.

get.description: Gets the GroupQuotaLimits for the specified resource provider and location for resource names passed in $filter=resourceName eq {SKU}.

get.summary: Get the status of a single GroupQuota request by requestId.
get.description: Get API to check the status of a GroupQuota request by requestId.

200.description: Success, with the details of the group quota request.

get.summary: Get the status of a single GroupQuota request by requestId.
get.description: Get API to check the status of a GroupQuota request by requestId.

200.description: Success, with the details of the group quota request.

patch.summary: Request to assign quota from group quota to a specific Subscription. This request will use Asynchronous pattern with 202 response and status polling API.
patch.description: Request to assign quota from group quota to a specific Subscription. The assign GroupQuota to subscriptions or reduce the quota allocated to subscription to give back the unused quota ( quota >= usages) to the groupQuota. So, this API can be used to assign Quota to subscriptions and assign back unused quota to group quota, which can be assigned to another subscriptions in the GroupQuota. User can collect unused quotas from multiple subscriptions within the groupQuota and assign the groupQuota to the subscription, where it's needed.

Retry-After.description: The recommended number of seconds to wait before calling the URI specified in Azure-AsyncOperation.

Location.description:
URL for determining when an operation has completed. Send a GET request to the URL in Location header.
The URI should return a 202 until the operation reaches a terminal state and 200 once it reaches a terminal state.

For more info: https://github.com/Azure/azure-resource-manager-rpc/blob/master/v1.0/Addendum.md#202-accepted-and-location-headers

get.summary: Gets all the quota allocated to a subscription for the specified resource provider and location for resource names passed in $filter=resourceName eq {SKU}.
get.description: Gets all the quota allocated to a subscription for the specified resource provider and location for resource names passed in $filter=resourceName eq {SKU}. This will include the GroupQuota and total quota allocated to the subscription. Only the Group quota allocated to the subscription can be allocated back to the MG Group Quota.

get.summary: Get the status of the quota allocation request for the subscriptionId.
get.description: Get the quota allocation request status for the subscriptionId by allocationId.

get.summary: Get all the quotaAllocationRequests for a resourceProvider/location.
get.description: Get all the quotaAllocationRequests for a resourceProvider/location. The filter paramter for location is required.

get.summary: Gets the GroupQuotas usages and limits(quota) for the resourceProvider/location.
get.description: Gets the GroupQuotas usages and limits(quota). Location is required paramter.

put.summary: Enables the GroupQuotas enforcement settings for the resource provider and the location specified.
put.description:
Enables the GroupQuotas enforcement for the resource provider and the location specified. The resource provider will start using the group quotas as the overall quota for the subscriptions included in the GroupQuota. The subscriptions cannot request quota at subscription level since it is now part of an enforced group.
The subscriptions share the GroupQuotaLimits assigned to the GroupQuota. If the GroupQuotaLimits is used, then submit a groupQuotaLimit request for the specific resource - provider/location/resource.
Once the GroupQuota Enforcement is enabled then, it cannot be deleted or reverted back. To disable GroupQuota Enforcement -
 1. Remove all the subscriptions from the groupQuota using the delete API for Subscriptions (Check the example - GroupQuotaSubscriptions_Delete).
 2. Then delete the GroupQuota (Check the example - GroupQuotas_Delete).

parameters.name: LocationSettings
parameters.description: The GroupQuota body details for creation or update of a GroupQuota entity.

Retry-After.description: The recommended number of seconds to wait before calling the URI specified in Azure-AsyncOperation.

Location.description:
URL for determining when an operation has completed. Send a GET request to the URL in Location header.
The URI should return a 202 until the operation reaches a terminal state and 200 once it reaches a terminal state.

For more info: https://github.com/Azure/azure-resource-manager-rpc/blob/master/v1.0/Addendum.md#202-accepted-and-location-headers.  New guidelines - https://github.com/microsoft/api-guidelines/blob/vNext/Guidelines.md#131-resource-based-long-running-operations-relo

URL for checking the ongoing status of the operation.

patch.summary: Enables the GroupQuotas enforcement settings for the resource provider and the location specified.
patch.description:
Enables the GroupQuotas enforcement for the resource provider and the location specified. The resource provider will start using the group quotas as the overall quota for the subscriptions included in the GroupQuota.  The subscriptions cannot request quota at subscription level since it is now part of an enforced group.
The subscriptions share the GroupQuotaLimits assigned to the GroupQuota. If the GroupQuotaLimits is used, then submit a groupQuotaLimit request for the specific resource - provider/location/resource.
Once the GroupQuota Enforcement is enabled then, it cannot be deleted or reverted back. To disable GroupQuota Enforcement -
 1. Remove all the subscriptions from the groupQuota using the delete API for Subscriptions (Check the example - GroupQuotaSubscriptions_Delete).
 2. Ten delete the GroupQuota (Check the example - GroupQuotas_Delete).

values.description: The quota request has been escalated for further review. Please file a support ticket. A support engineer will follow up.
The quota request is currently being processed.
The quota request has been canceled.
The quota request has been accepted.
The quota request has been created.

Based on - https://armwiki.azurewebsites.net/api_contracts/UsagesAPIContract.html?q=usages . Different RPs may have different units, Count, type as int64 should work for most of the integer values.

FilterLocationInQuery.name: $filter
FilterLocationInQuery.description:
| Field | Supported operators  
|---------------------|------------------------

 location eq {location}
 Example: $filter=location eq eastus

FilterResourceAndLocationInQuery.name: $filter
FilterResourceAndLocationInQuery.description:
| Field | Supported operators  
|---------------------|------------------------

 location eq {location} and resource eq {resourceName}
 Example: $filter=location eq eastus and resourceName eq cores
